ai-iti42:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti42:2.1_0: “These two bright things, mendicants, protect the world.
ai-iti42:2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-iti42:2.4_0: If these two bright things did not protect the world, there would be no recognition of the status of mother, aunts, or wives and partners of teachers and respected people.
ai-iti42:2.5_0: The world would become promiscuous, like goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and dogs and jackals.
ai-iti42:2.6_0: But because the two bright things protect the world, there is recognition of the status of mother, aunts, and wives and partners of teachers and respected people.”
ai-iti42:2.7_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti42:4.1_0: Those in whom conscience and shame
ai-iti42:4.4_0: being at peace, they will not be reborn again.”
ai-iti42:5.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
